definition: freedom from activity (work or strain or responsibility), be at rest
details:
noun
- freedom from activity (work or strain or responsibility)
= synonyms: relaxation
- a support on which things can be put
= example: a support on which things can be put
- a musical notation indicating a silence of a specified duration
- something left after other parts have been taken away
= synonyms: residual
- euphemism for death, based on an analogy between lying in a bed and in a tomb
= example: euphemism for death, based on an analogy between lying in a bed and in a tomb
= synonyms: eternal rest, sleep, eternal sleep, quietus
- a state of inaction
= example: a state of inaction
- a pause for relaxation
= example: a pause for relaxation
= synonyms: relief
verb
- be at rest
- stay the same
= synonyms: stay
- take a short break from one's activities in order to relax
= synonyms: breathe, catch one's breath, take a breather
- give a rest to
= example: give a rest to
- rest on or as if on a pillow
= synonyms: pillow
- sit, as on a branch
= synonyms: perch, roost
- not move
= example: not move
- put something in a resting position, as for support or steadying
- be inactive, refrain from acting
= example: be inactive, refrain from acting
- be inherent or innate in
= synonyms: repose
- have a place in relation to something else
= synonyms: lie
